content.raw: Fixed in [labscript devices PR 67](#!/labscript_suite/labscript_devices/pull-requests/67/pulse-width-fixes-issue-33/). For the PulseBlaster, anyway. The PineBlaster is not capable of asymmetric pulses as currently. It would be pretty easy to make it do asymmetric pulses, but I think the pineblaster is 'legacy' and I don't really want to change it. Rory's FPGA pulse generator (which should replace the PineBlaster as the recommended cheap way to make a pseudoclock) is capable of asymmetric pulses.
content.html: Fixed in labscript devices PR 67. For the PulseBlaster, anyway. The PineBlaster is not capable of asymmetric pulses as currently. It would be pretty easy to make it do asymmetric pulses, but I think the pineblaster is 'legacy' and I don't really want to change it. Rory's FPGA pulse generator (which should replace the PineBlaster as the recommended cheap way to make a pseudoclock) is capable of asymmetric pulses.
